title: Training of Facilitators (ToF) and on-going coaching and mentoring
author: Prak Sopheap
featuredImageCaption: Prak Sopheap, Project Coordinator, leading a training session.

text: Training of Facilitators (ToF) and ongoing coaching and mentoring are essential for effective community engagement and sustainable program implementation. This multi-pronged strategy equips a diverse group of facilitators, including DoSVY social workers, DoWA officials, CCWC focal points, local religious leaders, village leaders, and volunteers.

The program begins with a 3-day Training of Facilitators (ToF) workshop designed to enhance facilitation skills, communication techniques, and knowledge-sharing practices. Participants engage in interactive learning, role-playing scenarios, and problem-solving exercises to prepare them for real-world facilitation.

sections.heading: Ongoing Coaching and Mentoring Support
text: To ensure quality and consistency in training delivery, the program incorporates continuous coaching and mentoring support. Facilitators receive regular guidance and constructive feedback, enabling them to refine their skills and effectively address challenges.

These ongoing mentorship opportunities help facilitators adapt the training program to the specific needs of their communities. Regular check-ins and peer support networks further enhance their confidence and ability to engage parents and caregivers in meaningful discussions.

images.caption: Mentoring sessions provide facilitators with ongoing support.

sections.heading: Empowering Communities Through Effective Facilitation
text: By equipping facilitators with strong skills and continuous support, the program fosters sustainable community development. Trained facilitators become catalysts for positive change, creating a ripple effect that enhances parental engagement, knowledge-sharing, and collective problem-solving.

This approach not only strengthens facilitators' capabilities but also empowers communities to take an active role in their development. With the right tools and guidance, facilitators inspire and educate, ultimately improving the well-being of families and children.
